line_1: Dishonour'd but to cool a transient gust
line_2: Of some luxurious Satrap's barb'rous lust.

line_1: He drinks his simple bev'rage with a gust,
line_2: And feasting on an onion and a crust,

line_1: Such writers and such readers owe the gust
line_2: And relish of their pleasure all to lust.

line_1: Destroy all Creatures for thy sport or gust,
line_2: Yet cry, if Man's unhappy, God's unjust,

line_1: When lo! a whirlwind's instantaneous gust
line_2: Left all its beauties withering in the dust.

line_1: And wafted with its Foe by violent Gust,
line_2: 'Twas doubtful which was Rain, and which was Dust.
